stories.text:
Many argue that the right/left political divide is particularly pronounced at the moment in the United States - perhaps too much so.

I'm not for a moment suggesting that this problem should be "solved" per se - a healthy political divide is necessary for the exchange and development of ideas. But I wonder if there's a way to render it more effective, and at least mitigate the seemingly visceral divide in American society. Any ideas on how the internet could help in this realm (for once)?

What about a website where ordinary citizens of opposing views get matched up, and are forced to have a video call with one another on a particular issue e.g. abortion. I presume a video call with a stranger would somewhat encourage "listening" and general "politeness", more so than on Twitter/Facebook.

Maybe you could record the calls and post them for others to watch.

Any thoughts on this topic?
stories.title: How to conquer American political divide?

stories.text:
To my fellow freelancers who live in the EU: What's the best bank to get paid in USD? I live in Germany and currently use Revolut, which works fine. But I don't particularly like the company and the app experience. I'm planning to switching to Wise, even though they are more expensive.

Do you have any recommendations?
stories.title: Ask HN: Freelancers in EU, best bank to get paid in USD?
